backend.src.app.services.clients package

Submodules

backend.src.app.services.clients.client_service module

class backend.src.app.services.clients.client_service.ClientService(client_id, update_data=None)[source]

Bases: object

The ClientService class provides methods for managing client data.

This class acts as a service for validating, updating, deleting, and preparing data related to a client.

Variables:

  • client_id – The ID of the client.

  • update_data – The data to update for the client.

  • client_repository – An instance of the ClientRepository class for interacting with client data.

delete_client()[source]

Delete the client.

This method uses the client repository to delete the client based on their ID.

prepare_response_with_client_data()[source]

Prepare a response containing all data about the client.

This method uses the client repository to retrieve all data about the client.

Returns:

A dictionary containing all data about the client.

Return type:

dict[str, any]

update_client_data()[source]

Update the client’s data.

This method uses the client repository to update the client’s data.

Returns:

The bool if the client was successfully updated.

Return type:

bool

validate_client()[source]

Validate the client’s existence.

This method uses the client repository to validate the existence of the client based on their ID.

Returns:

True if the client exists, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

backend.src.app.services.clients.clients_service module

class backend.src.app.services.clients.clients_service.ClientsService(create_data=None)[source]

Bases: object

The ClientsService class provides methods for managing multiple clients’ data.

This class acts as a service for creating new clients and preparing data related to all clients.

Variables:

create_data – The data for creating a new client.

create_client()[source]

Create a new client.

This method uses the clients repository to create a new client with the provided data.

Returns:

True if the client was created, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

prepare_response_with_clients_data()[source]

Prepare a response containing data about all clients.

This method uses the clients repository to retrieve data about all clients. The return value is a list of dictionaries, where each dictionary contains data about a specific client.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, where each dictionary contains data about a specific client.

Return type:

list[dict[str, any]]

backend.src.app.services.clients.clients_sort_service module

class backend.src.app.services.clients.clients_sort_service.ClientsSortService(sort_data)[source]

Bases: object

The ClientsSortService class provides a method to sort client data.

This class acts as a service for sorting data related to clients.

Variables:

sort_data – The data specifying how clients should be sorted.

sort_clients()[source]

Sort client data based on the provided parameters.

This method uses the ClientsRepository to sort all clients based on the sorting data.

Returns:

The sorted list of dictionaries, where each dictionary contains data about a specific client, or None if the sort data wasn’t valid.

Return type:

list[dict[str, any]] or None
